doc.title: On Our Own Land
doc.plot: On Our Own Land chronicles the citizens' fight to have the broad-form deed declared unconstitutional in Kentucky. The story unfolds through the voices of local people as the viewer meets a family determined not to move their father's grave for strip miners, sees the rubble of a strip job "reclaimed" to the letter of the law, and watches as citizens protest strip mine abuses and push the state legislature for reform.
